in_ports.name: x
in_ports.hint: Can be skipped, then x will be the first column of "x/y".

in_ports.name: y
in_ports.hint: Can be skipped, then y will be the second column of "x/y".

in_ports.caption: x/y
in_ports.name: x_y
in_ports.hint: 2-column array with x/y pairs. Used only if "x" and/or "y" above is not initialized.

out_ports.name: r
out_ports.hint: Radial polar coordinate r (magnitude: square root from x²+y²).

out_ports.caption: φ
out_ports.name: fi
out_ports.hint: Angle polar coordinate φ (arctangent of y/x, more exactly, atan2(y,x)).

controls.name: angleMultiplier
controls.caption: Angle multiplier M
controls.description: Actual result angle φ is M*ψ, where ψ is the arctangent, represented in the range specified above. For example, if x=−1 and y=0 (angle 180°) and the angle range is "−1..+1 instead of −π..+π", the result angle will be −M. This is convenient to return results in degree: just specify M=180.

controls.name: angleForLittleSquare
controls.caption: Special angle
controls.description: If x²+y²≤ε², we return this special angle instead of arctangent (atan2 function becomes unstable for very little x²+y² and has no sense for x=y=0). If ε² is negative, this feature is not used.

controls.caption: x column
controls.description: If the source "x" is multi-column, its column with this index will be used as x values.
controls.name: indexInBlockX

controls.caption: y column
controls.description: If the source "y" is multi-column, its column with this index will be used as y values.
controls.name: indexInBlockY

controls.caption: x/y columns
controls.description: If the source "x/y" is multi-column, its columns with this and following indexes will be used as x and y values.
controls.name: indexInBlockX_y
